Reviews.Title: “Second Class treatment if Priceline or Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: bwondo
Reviews.Content: If you book a room at this hotel through bidding at Priceline or through Hot Rates at Hotwire, you do not get the advertised amenities. Even though complimentary cocktails are touted on the Radisson site and on Priceline, the hotel refuses these to Priceline or Hotwire guests. And, the free complimentary breakfast that everyone else gets does not apply to Priceline or Hotwire guests. For instance: The hotel and Priceline refused to give free cocktails despite repeated representations that free cocktails applied to all guests (Priceline details of hotel, Radisson web site, and even the hotel guide in the rooms). It was very frustrating to repeatedly get a runaround, and not even an apology or even a recognition that the advertising was incorrect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Neal R
Reviews.Content: The food and food service are excellent. A very comfortable, calm and relaxing atmosphere. A very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: Denverrez
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, quiet and easily accessible to most everything. It is located right of the 15. The rooms were quiet, well kept, clean and comfortable. Staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The breakfasts weren't worth the effort, but a great place for a free cup of coffee in the morning. Definitely worth a look if you're planning to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with comfortable amenties”
Reviews.Author: AZGlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here. The bed was comfortable and the hotel well-kept. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast buffets and two complimentary cocktails at the onsite restaurant. The food there was excellent and the bartender sociable and hard-working. The hot tub was nice and warm and the pool appeared clean. The only drawback was the foulest smelling elevator we have ever ridden in. We chose to climb to the third floor to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Interstate”
Reviews.Author: pa3ddg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a week on a business trip. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean and there was a good wired internet. When I arrive at the evening, the bed was put down a a chocolate was waiting for me. Sometime I did use the WiFi for my Smartphone. No problems with it, although some peers did complain about the WiFi. For some people it is bad, but for me no problem: The bar closes at 22:00 I do need to say that when one is having a room at the inner yard, one will hear the noise from the pool and the bar in my room. So for an intercontinental traveller trying to go bed early after a long flight, it is not very silent. Although the closing at 22:00 contributes on silence around 22:30. The pool itself is nice. When going back to San Diego, I might return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: mamason
Reviews.Content: I was expecting this to be a good hotel based on all the other positive reviews, however my experience was not great. To start off, the girl working the front desk acted as if I was inconveniencing her by having to check me in. Onto the room...I won this hotel on a Priceline bid and I think I got stuck in the 'Priceline room.' While laying in bed the corner of the sheet came up so I went to put it back on and noticed some disgusting stuff on the wall (possibly vomit?) It's beyond me how housekeeping could have missed this as it's clearly visible when making the bed. The bathroom floor was also dirty and the furniture in the room was very tired-knicks & scratches on everything. I don't think I would be willing to give this hotel another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Knersus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business purposes over a very long extended period of time, adding up to several months in total, so it really is a home away from home. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. The staff here are super friendly and always went out of their way to accommodate us, make our stay easier and better. I have rarely seen such good service anywhere! The rooms are nice and spacious with all the basics that you need while travelling. The pool in the middle with the palm trees around really remind you that you are now in California. The location is probably not ideal for holiday travelers because it's quite far from most attractions, but perfect for business trips to the many business parks in the area. The restaurant is really good.. especially for breakfasts! If you get tired of the hotel restaurant there are a ton of other good restaurants nearby that the friendly free shuttle can take you to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: April S
Reviews.Content: Being in the hotel industry I know a good hotel when I see one. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. We stayed here for two nights and had the best time. Employees go above and beyond to ensure you are satisfied. Everyone was smiling and willing to answer any questions we had. Johnathan at the front desk was very personable and even helped us out with directions to his favorite local beaches and restaurants. The gym is small but had everything needed for a great workout. The pool area was nice- My only complaint is that is closes pretty early (9pm). The complimentary breakfast and drinks were awesome! The room was clean and huge. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL WEDDING”
Reviews.Author: tl4tl
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to attend a very dear friends wedding this weekend at the Radisson. I must say the rooms were spacious, the pool was fantastic and the breakfast that is included is among the best I have experienced. The event staff did a wonderful job with the layout, spacing and food for the wedding / reception. The hotel is an easy on / off to I-15, gas stations and local restaurants as well. Thanks for the great job....keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for business”
Reviews.Author: Mka_Finland
Reviews.Content: - Extremely good shuttle service always available. - Good room service - Cozy restaurant with a smiley service - Decent gym - Bad (not ergonomic at working desk chair) - Good breakfast - Nice looking pool area when it is warmer weather

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: Machilus
Reviews.Content: I just booked one day for fun and participated one of radisson's promotion. Arriving at this hotel at late night, I still found it was a beautiful place. The lobby was decorated with Christmas tree so it was very like home. The front staff that night was very helpful. As a silver member, I was upgraded to business class. The room was very good and comfortable. Big Sofa, good space and everywhere clean. The room equipped with three-in-one printer, iHome, very good for business and leisure traveler. I have to emphases that the internet speed was pretty good!! It could be called REAL HIGH-SPEED INTERNET. They offer complimentary hot breakfast. Both the quality and environment was pretty good. Food was delicious. There is one thing I confused but the front desk didn't answer me well. I booked through radisson.com and prepaid my night. I asked for a receipt but the front desk told me, my booking was made through a travel agency. Finally, she gave me the receipt, I checked the account was exactly the same as I paid. Could manager help answer this?

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. It was not as nice as I had expected based on the reviews I read on trip advisor. We had a king bed with a pullout couch. There was just one tv and it swiveled between the couch area and the bed. It had an adjustable sleep number bed. It squeaked loudly when we rolled over. We could hear the shower running in the rooms that bordered our room very clearly which woke my kids up a few times. All of the rooms had big windows that bordered the outside hallway like a motel. In the morning we were woken up by people talking outside our room. The breakfast was pretty good (bacon, sausage, eggs, pancakes,toast, juice, coffee). They allowed us to check in a little early which we very much appreciated. A lot of security guards roaming around which made us a bit nervous about the clientele. All in all, it was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service 5 *”
Reviews.Author: Triciam1110
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week on business although I would agree with previous posts the rooms are comfortable but slightly tired, however , the service is 5 * and beyond nothing is to much trouble . Everything I asked or enquired about was sorted out immediately with a smile :) MANAGER AND STAFF WERE EXCELLENT

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service and Great Rooms for the Cost”
Reviews.Author: jesterline
Reviews.Content: I had a short 1 night stay, but it was excellent for the price that I paid. In the end, including taxes, the cost was approximately $100. The room itself was really pretty nice for what I needed. It was spacious with a separate living area and bedroom area, not separate rooms but divided by a partial wall and TV. The bed was really big and very comfortable with a nice comforter and plenty of pillows. The bathroom was very clean and was fully stocked with overnight amenities (shampoos, soaps, etc.). The shower also had one of those bowed curtain rods that pulls the shower curtain away from the user, which I love. There wasn't really anything to complain about, but I the desk chair and couch seemed a little dated. Regarding customer service, the front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful both with check-in and when I phoned in to make my reservation. If I had a reason to stay overnight in this area again, I would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanjovi
Reviews.Content: I had a short 5 day stay. Missed the pool, but it looked clean, well kept. Room was v clean..But hated the huge 40 inch Big Box TV, which worked like crap. The morning breakfast had very good, choice. The evening complimentary drink too was nice...The only thing I hated was at 12:30 midnight, everyday the wireless internet would stop working, and wouldn't be fixed till 7am next day. $100 corp price was pretty worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AJS54
Reviews.Content: Two years have passed since I last stayed here for a weekend business trip, and this remains an excellent hotel. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. And the property, although not new, is very well maintained. The hotel layout is convenient, the rooms are well furnished, and the restaurant serves a very good buffet. I hope to return again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Diane L
Reviews.Content: This is a great property -- beautiful room and furniture. Even the carpeting was new. Very quiet and compact. I really enjoyed the heated pool and hot tub. The wait staff at J.J.'s Grill were very nice as well as the front desk staff. They were very helpful in getting me directions to dog beach. The property is beautiful with a cobble stoned entrance. It is very close to the San Diego Wild Animal Park. My only criticism is that the parking spaces are way too small. A person cannot fit between the cars, and it is impossible to fully open your car doors on either side when other cars are parked beside you. This upscale hotel is dog friendly with only a $25 fee for your pet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Straight_Forward
Reviews.Content: Everyone working at this hotel is professional, efficient and friendly. They actually seem genuinely happy. Loved the Teak pool furniture and the friendly bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: jimswe007
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many hotels in San Diego, I have developed a pretty good understanding of the city and its different areas. When in town I work in the Rancho Bernardo area that is home to HP, Sony, NCR, and a number of other companies. Many people do not realize that Rancho Bernardo is still a San Diego address, actually as close to the north part of San Diego without getting into Escondido. If you are traveling for business or beaches, stay north. If you are going for conventions or the downtown scene stay south. Where this hotel shines is as a business hotel with really great consistent rates along with a nice property and amazing customer service. This hotel is not the four seasons, but if it were my boss wouldn't let me stay here because of the price. What I do get out of this property is a clean, very comfortable bed, in an oversized room. I get a great location, easy access to work and the rest of the city. I also enjoy the free drink coupon at their poolside restaurant and bar. Their internet services is the best around. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the business traveler who wants consistent and a great value with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Bed to Sleep In”
Reviews.Author: tuffy
Reviews.Content: With so many hotels to choose from in San Diego, one would wonder why we chose to stay at the Radisson. First of all, the location was key because we needed to be in the Poway/Rancho Bernardo area. Secondly, we didn't want to pay more than $200/a night. Well, the property is just plain dated. Our room decor was dark and felt a little dirty. The bedding was sufficient and comfortable. The bathroom was a little small but clean. Overall, it's not the kind of room you'll want to hang out in. The comp breakfast was good. It offered a variety of items including eggs and sausages or bacon which were a nice option for us low carb eaters. I saw a few softball teams staying there as well as families and business people. While it's not a resort by any means, it's a decent place to stay in San Diego if you want to be in the North County area. Our room was on the botttom floor facing the parking lot. We often found parking right outside our door. It was convenient. Request a room on a higher floor if you want privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rate, nice room, but loud”
Reviews.Author: Romans5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia and got a whopper of a bargain. One thing to note is that there are a variety of rates available - some include breakfast, some don't. Mine did not, but it turned out to be a non-issue since my days started at 5am. In general, I found the staff to be very kind and helpful. When I checked in, the lady at the front desk gave me a choice of the two rooms that were available at the time. That's something you rarely get to do. In the lobby, there are two computers for guests to use. When the mouse stopped working on one machine, Cory immediately went looking for a spare mouse for the computer. I personally liked the room. The things that are important for me in a hotel room are a comfortable bed and cleanliness. I don't mind the fact that there wasn't a flat screen TV. Since decor is based on personal taste, I've included pictures of my room so you can be the judge. The alarm clock had an iPod docking station. Now the reason why I didn't give the hotel a higher rating. The hotel has exterior corridors, so noise can be much more of an issue. The first night I was there, I did not have an issue with noise. Unfortunately, during the rest of my stay in San Diego, 10,000 athletes also came to San Diego and there were quite a few staying at the Radisson. I did not appreciate the fact that there were kids running up and down the corridors and yelling late at night in light of the fact that I had early mornings. The only way I was able to sleep was to use my noise cancelling earphones. The issue just might be the timing of my visit. I did talk to people that stayed in other hotels during the same period, and quite a few had the same issue.

Reviews.Title: “fun, inexpensive getaway to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jake-hansen
Reviews.Content: we booked our trip to San Diego with a budget conscience mindset. Our goal was purely to scout out our Comicon adventure week. This hotel has a really nice pool and they gave us free drink coupons for the bar. The restaurant has really great food and amazing service. This hotel is a ways from downtown, but still easy to get to everything. Price was cheap for San Diego during the summertime.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but average for value.”
Reviews.Author: bloonstowerdefence
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a good stay at this hotel. I'll tell you the pros and cons below. Pros: 1. My check in was perfect and fast. Took about three minutes. 5 stars out of 5. 2. I had a good night sleep, and heard no noise. 5 stars out of 5. 3. Breakfast at the restaurant was, overall great. 4 stars out of 5. 4. Room 134 was clean with no stains. No hairs or stains anywhere. 4 stars out of 5. 5. There was a refrigerator and a sink in our room. It was important. 4 stars out of 5. 6. The room size was somewhat a little bigger than averages ones. 4 stars out of 5. 7. Location was good. Close to most things I go to. Easy to find off the freeway. 4 stars out of 5. Cons: 1. Even if I had a good night sleep the beds weren't very comfortable, average bed. 3 stars out of 5. 2. The parking spaces were short. 2 stars out of 5. 3. All of the room was outdated except the beds. That reminded me of a building that was built between 1985 and 1990. Needs renovating in standard rooms. TV was old and had 30 channels. 2 stars out of 5. 4. The internet was complimentary, but hard to connect. And once connected, it loads slowly. 2 stars out of 5. 5. Bathroom was very small for a big room. 2 stars out of 5. So overall it was great. But just average for a value. Why pay about $150 per night for outdated rooms and slow internet, and not very comfortable Sleep Number beds? But, I give my stay here 4 stars. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: jaybo1200
Reviews.Content: stayed in room 257, flat panel 42"Tv wall mounted, only 3-5 rooms have this TV the others have old school tube TV's. Overall the facility was nice, very clean pool and courtyard area, good food from the restaurant and for the price the room and bed were extremely comfy.

Reviews.Title: “great place to escape from my home remodeling project”
Reviews.Author: markbkirk
Reviews.Content: I am in the middle of a home remodeling project and I wanted to get away for a few days, from the "construction mess". After searching area properties for something not too far away, I found some really good pricing on this hotel. I read the reviews here, some good, some mixed, but I thought at this price I cant go wrong. Well, I am glad that I stayed here. The televisions are a little dated, but the pool, the restaurant, the internet and the staff are simply outstanding. I was very happy to get this much for the money. I would highly recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fast internet and Service my Italian Grandmother would love!”
Reviews.Author: stefanow1
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say that when I am used to LA people, maybe I get a little jaded. I recently took a business trip to San Diego and everywhere that I went the service was AMAZING. I really need to get to San Diego more often. I chose this hotel initially because I needed a really fast internet connection to download videos for our presentation with clients over the week. I called around and most places had no clue what I was talking about. When I talked to someone at this hotel they had to check, but they came back with the exact details I needed for my VPN, download speeds, latency, etc. It got even better when I checked in, the service was great, they even helped track down my taxi driver where I left a small bag in the back seat. Wonderful! The rooms were very comfortable and quiet. The pool was a really nice touch, especially for a business hotel. My boss is notoriously cheap, so I cant imagine he spent too much on this room, but it was really nice. Overall I have to highly recommend this place, and I also had to tell my grandmother that people still have manners and service that would make her proud!

Reviews.Title: “best business hotel in Rancho Bernardo!”
Reviews.Author: sarahmarieb2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed here here in June with a planning workshop my company put on with two major customers in RB. There are only a few choices of hotels directly in Rancho Bernardo with this one definitely a favorite for business. The rooms are immaculate and very comfortable. They are very spacious and give you plenty of room to spread work items over the different tables, beds, couch, end tables, counters, etc. I had plenty of room to work in. The printer I brought with me ran out of ink at the last minute. I called the front desk and the person was so wonderful, she helped print everything at the computer in the lobby for free! Internet was lighting fast and the salad with cranberries and walnuts at the small restaurant onsite was really good. Since this was paid for by my company I dont know the exact rate but I know they gave us one heck of a deal, Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value business hotel for Rancho Bernardo”
Reviews.Author: Timd001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business last week, its super close to the Sony campus which made it very convenient. Service was impeccable, the front desk went out of their way to accomodate with a last minute airport shuttle. The Internet access was very fast and let me stream hd Netflix even while working on files across our company VPN. I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Ummmm the word FAKE comes to mind”
Reviews.Author: Gab_lavin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 350, which was an "upgrade"... UNDER STATEMENT..... that staff is great, Rebecca helped me even set up my reservations for my husband and I to an amazing restaurant , and with my internet, which was a PAIN. That is the only nice thing i can say about this hotel... The rooms are out side- i found many bugs and pool noise is unaccountable.... the food from JJ's for dinner was amazing!! i love it!!... I must say that kelly the Night Manager was rude and made me feel like i was a bother from her gossip from fellow co-workers... I only gave this a 4 star because of Rebecca, but the rooms and other co-workers acted if i was only a bother

Reviews.Title: “WHo's writing these positive reviews?”
Reviews.Author: awats45
Reviews.Content: I'm suspicious of these reviews. I read them before I stayed there and trusted them. I was wrong and they are wrong. I stayed there one night while visiting the Wild Animal Park with my fiance, and we'll never go back there again. First of all, for the price you pay, it sure feels like you're staying at a cheap motel with outdoor walkways and room entrances. The rooms are old and out of date. The television was old school and had terrible reception. The wi-fi didn't work properly and was difficult to connect to and very slow once connected. The breakfast was terrible. Not much selection and everything tasted cold and bland. Even the key to the door didn't work properly. I thought maybe it was just me putting in the key incorrectly, or that particular lock or key acting up, but I saw the neighbors also locked out of their room, so I know this is problematic for the hotel. There's not very many people around the hotel and I'm sure they're struggling financially, so I'm not surprised by the aging condition of the facilities. I was sent a survey by the hotel after my stay and told them all the same things I mentioned here. I received an email back from the hotel manager who said, in summary, sorry for your experience, come back again. Really? Now I came back to this site to read all the positive reviews and felt compelled to write the truth. It's obvious that hotel insiders are writing phony glowing reviews because no one is dumb enough to pay in excess of $100 per night for what amounts to a Motel 6 experience, then write a good review. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Pleasnat stay”
Reviews.Author: Gmatti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a vacation in San Diego. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and well maintained, buffet breakfast was good. Complimentary wireless internet connection was great. We didn't use the pool althogh it was clean and tempting. The only drawback was lack of safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: phlattires
Reviews.Content: The hotel was mediocre at best. The room were typical for a 2-3 star hotel. I spent two nights there for work and I got a decent night sleep -- they offer sleep number beds. The staff was friendly and did their best to make my trip confortable

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RedLodger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while interviewing for a job. I learned at check-in, that although the company had made all the arrangements, I was to pay for the room and expense it. The front desk staff was very understanding, and gave me a much better nightly rate than the reservation price. The rooms all have outdoor entrances, and the area around the hotel is not threatening by any means. There is at least 1 security guard that roams the parking lot area during the night time hours. The free breakfast buffet was limited in selection, but cooked perfectly. I had an early flight out and arrived for breakfast 10 minutes before opening time. I was invited in for coffee, and offered some muffins to go if I desired them. The hot items were available just before opening at 6am, and the staff let me know that it was okay for me to help myself. The sleep number bed was a new experience, but honestly, I could not find a "perfect setting" as shown on the commercials. None the less, it was comfortable enough for two good nights of sleep. The room was quiet, but I was located on the outside area that faces the parking lot, not the pool. A newspaper was at my door on the first morning, but not on check-out day. My receipt was slipped under the door sometime before I woke up at 5am. The room was clean and well maintained. Although I had a coupon for a free cocktail each night, I was too busy both days to use it. Overall, it rates a solid 4.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great employees.....very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: txblluebonnet
Reviews.Content: The employees here are so friendly and helpful. There is a buffet breakfast in the morning that is decent. Not realizing that it ended at 9am, we arrived late, but they just put more plates and food out for us! The pool is heated and decent. Rooms were clean and well maintained. Only drawback is the distance to a lot of the attractions in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I just threw up a little bit in my mouth”
Reviews.Author: jayster
Reviews.Content: The morning we were checking out, my partner and I reflected on our hotel experiences and determined this was the worst one. We chose the hotel because they allow pets and their pet fee was way below the other properties. We, unfortunately, came to find out there's a reason this property was so much cheaper. I stayed in the car as he checked in. When the doors from the outside opened, music was blaring from a party booked in the party room. A buffet was set up for this party right in the lobby and children were running around all over the place -- at 11:00pm!!!!! The only saving grace to this property is the staff. They took the first night off the bill for the inconvenience. They have a bend-over-backwards attitude which is even sometimes absent at the finest resorts. The rooms are gloomy. We could not tell if the sofa was old and dirty or just really ugly. The room, however, was spacious. It was somewhat clean, however the coffee maker was dingy. The look is weird. The bedding looks somewhat new. The beds look old. The towel rod in the showe rod feel and cut my foot. The wallpaper in the bathroom and sink basin look new. The tub walls are white, yet the tub itself is an old and dingy yellow. The bathroom has only a sliding door which stays slightly open. The bathroom is very small. The property itself leaves much to be desired. It is really a 3-story cramped motel. Many of the guests on Saturday night chose to drink beer shirtless at the outdoor halls. The parking is very limited. The pool is in very close proximity to the inside courtyard rooms and the acoustics are terrible. This seems to be a bit of an "event" hotel. As mentioned, they book parties in their facility which is also very close to rooms. On the positive/negative side, the loud air conditioning covered the noise. Young soccer teams were booked into the hotel. The staff offered to change our room because it was close to the party area, but we discovered it was the "bride room" for a nearby wedding. However, kudos again to the great staff for holding a room aside for us to check. Also, a note if you want to visit the attractions of San Diego. Rancho Bernardo is to the north. You are look at a 30 minute drive to downtown San Diego. The only thing keeping this from a 1-star rating is the staff and a great (free) breakfast and cocktail in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Older but adequate”
Reviews.Author: difrans10
Reviews.Content: We were in a spacious second floor suite, with a small fridge and microwave, which is good, the bathroom was a bit dated as were the furnishings, including the sleep number bed (which had a wired remote and a very loud pump) We were in the back near the pool side restaurant/bar which was not good at 5:30 when they started preparing breakfast noisily. The room faced in overlooking the courtyard and pool, nice view, however lots of sounds echoed and came in either from the wall a/c unit or the thin window or both? Also they could not provide a later checkout because they are short on cleaning staff for the summer, however they did give us a half hour. Another average thing was the fitness center, really small, yet had new equipment, temp. controls and water in the room. Booked with Radisson directly for $135, and parking was included so it's an average value too. If booked through some discount vendor it would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming atmosphere; safe & comfortable neighborhood; very large, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeeMom
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, well-groomed facility in a beautiful, safe neighborhood. Easy access to I-15 & just minutes away from the 56 (Ted Williams Pkwy), which offers quick connect to the I-5/805. Very accommodating front desk staff--pleasant, courteous, & efficient, with excellent customer service follow-through. Medium-sized 3-story hotel with extra large spacious rooms (suites); both of ours had refrig, microwave, & wetbar; separate "livingrm" area w/sofabed, coffee table, & regular table; all this, yet not cramped at all! Ample FREE parking--not a problem even when we returned late at night. Our pkg incl. free breakfast buffet (2 per rm) & free evening drink. Free morning newspaper del'd to room door. We've been to many different hotels/motels. If you're on a limited budget, this is definitely one of the best values out there w/o compromising on quality! Even better than many of higher-priced facilities. Check out their AAA discount if you're a member.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Family”
Reviews.Author: Frankito
Reviews.Content: Radisson H (M)otel is located close to freeway 15 in Rancho Bernado Area (but still a quite place on top of hill) - 15 min to Wild Animal park - 20 min to Seaworld - 30 min to San Diego Airport - offers outstanding service as well as free internet / no parking free and affordable breakfeast rates in patio style atmosphere with yakuzi and pool - we stayed there for 4 days with 2 kids 7 and 1 year - very pleasent expierience

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: DKS1234
Reviews.Content: My family of four recently visited the Wild Animal Park and wanted to find a place to stay that was nearby. The Radisson Suite Hotel Rancho Bernardo seemed like a good choice...it ended up being a great choice! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are not really suites, but they were clean and larger than your average hotel room. In the room, there is a mini refrigerator, microwave, and a dvd player. The sleep number beds are super comfortable. Also, included in our rate, we received two complimentary cocktails and buffet breakfasts. And, to top it off, they let my 8 year old daughter eat for free! Sure, she's not a big eater, but most places would still charge a full price for her. For the price, I couldn't have asked for more. We will definitely stay here again if we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a motel, Ehh for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccgreynolds
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay directly since our in-laws live about 10 minutes away. If you're looking for a lovely bed, wonderful sheets like the pictures on their website, and indoor rooms, you won't find it here! The bedding and sheets were similar to a small motel and the rooms were outdoor. Odd for what we paid per night before taxes $198! I would have thought it would be a hotel but it was more like a Motel 6. You should definitely clarify your room specifications before arrival. Breakfast was $8 and consisted of dry cereal, scrambled eggs, and hashbrown.

Reviews.Title: “recommend this one”
Reviews.Author: LA_County_Mom
Reviews.Content: Despite no television service throughout complex plus most, if not all, other rooms occupied the night I stayed in a room facing the parking lot, this hotel was a very comfortable, clean and quiet place. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They apologized upon check-in about lack of TV service in the area (it was not limited to the hotel) and provided me with choice of DVD movies. I slept well on the numbers adjustable bed, and had a pleasant, healthy breakfast at JJ's Grill, the on-site restaurant, before check out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenandcraig
Reviews.Content: I must say, surprisingly enough the pictures of the hotel on Expedia do not do it justice. The hotel is a little hidden on the mountain-side by lush greenery (not a bad thing), it's conveniently located right-off the freeway. We had 4 people traveling, 2 adults, 2 kids. They classfied the room as a suite, which is a little bit of a stretch, but is was very nicely decorated. Not your usual grandma covered, flowered comforter, it was a clean, fresh down blanket, the room did have a microwave, frig, free internet, and free parking. Driving a SUV, I did find parking spaces were a bit snug though. Our room had a Sleep Number Bed, which was a little noisy operating, but very comfortable to sleep on. The room is seperated by a pony wall and on 1 side you can watch T.V. on the sofa-bed or swivel it to where the bed is located. The room was located on the 1st floor, across from the heated-pool and jacuzzi, so with kids it was easily accessed and not noisey at all! There is a restraunt on premises called JJ's Grill. They do serve breakfast (buffet style only) for $7 a person, to my surprise they did not charge for kids! Pasteries, pancakes, eggs, sausage, oatmeal, coffee, teas. Really a good variety, just don't expect high-quality. Every adult does get 1 free alcoholic beverage each evening, which is nice. The Grill also serves dinner as well. Although, we ventured to The Elephant Bar just down the street, which has a great selection and great food! You can drive a couple exits' down and will find many places to eat or go to Old Town or Balboa Bay and have a ton of shopping, a variety of dining choices, and the Ocean breeze only about 20 minutes away. Check-in is normally @ 3pm, but they let us check in at about 12:30 (we just drove in from Vegas), which was a pleasant surprise! I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingmumof3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was just right for what we needed. When we arrived we were moved up to a third floor room which was so good as we didn't have loads of people walking past nor the noise from the restaurant/bar or pool. It was actually a very quiet hotel even though it was very busy. We ate in the hotel on the first night and got a free drink for both my husband and myself. The food was really fresh and well cooked - delicious for all of us. The pool and hot tub looked lovely but the weather was just a bit too cold to tempt us in. There is a great, cheap launderette on site which makes it very easy when you are travelling a lot as we were. The room was a great size again with a big sofa bed and two doubles. My only little complaint is that the bed was just not comfortable. Overall very friendly and great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved The Help From The Banquets Department!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: California_Lover_8
Reviews.Content: I Stayed for only one day at the Radisson Suites Hotel. My stay was great. The hotel was kind of hidden but I found it. I went to the front desk and they were giving me attitude at first,but they were fast in customer service! I had some questions on where things were in the hotel. I met some employees by the Banquets Room. They were really busy, but they seem to find the time and help a guest out. I don't know all there names, but I believe one of there names was Jorge. He was very helpful in giving me directions and very kind.I like to come to a place that people don't ignore me.....some other places do. But your hotel was very kind to me. I would gladly recommend people to stay at The Radisson. I LOVED the place, will see me soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night only. Was surprised to find outdoor entrances to rooms, havent been to many Radissons where that was the case, most have indoor hallways. This is San Diego I suppose so not really a problem for the weather. The room was not a giant suite but did have a nice sitting area, decent size bedroom and a decent bathroom. I did find a couple long brown hairs in one of my towels which was kind of gross since I am a man with short hair, but there were other towels and really, how picky can you be? The Hotel itself must have finished remodeling because it was all fairly nice. My rate included a free drink at the bar as well as a 'real' breakfast in the morning. Very cool, although the restuarant was a bit tiny it wasnt too crowded. This is a pretty nice hotel and the price was right. I would have no issues with staying here again nor would I hesitate to recomend it to my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Not really in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: gonebyby
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just south of Escondido and a good half hour away from San Diego (without traffic). It is advertised as 6.5 miles from the Wild Animal Park, but you would need an ultralight, otherwise it's more like 10+ miles. The room was fine and seemed clean and was quiet. There's a nice marble counter with sink but it is so loaded up with frig and microwave you can't use any of the space. There is also a bar frig beneath. I put some yogurt in the empty frig on top but didn't notice it was unplugged, so the yogurt was no good to eat in the morning. It would be nice if they gave a bag of popcorn to microwave in the room. All and all a good place to stay. Oh, they gave two drink coupons for the restaurant bar. That was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in a lovely suite on the 31st of August 2007. Absolutely no complaints. Great reception at the front desk, complimentary cocktail at nite and a very nice pool and surroundings. We found the room to be clean and the beds very comforable. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to anyone who would need a place to stay in the area. We had spent the day at the Wildlife Park(during a very uncomfortable heat wave) and drove only about 5 or 10 minutes to the Hotel. We ate out for dinner at Claim Jumpers. It was delicious! We had a great stay here at the Radisson, you will too!

Reviews.Title: “How disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: 2Kids4Dogs
Reviews.Content: "How disappointing!" Those were my first words when we entered our room at this hotel. The room was dark, dated, and the bedspreads were weirdly iridescent and tacky. Calling this room a "suite" is quite a stretch. It was somewhat bigger than the average hotel room with a sofa bed and a sink/fridge/minibar. Hardly a suite. The mattresses were quite old and just comfortable enough to sleep on. When was the last time you saw black mattresses with a bright floral print? Oddly, beneath the weird bedspreads were down comforters in white cotton duvet covers. You'd think they would dump the bedspreads and go with the duvets as many upscale hotels are doing. I selected this hotel and their "junior suite" because we were traveling with my mother-in-law and would have five people in the room. Once we brought in our luggage, we had minimal walking space. I was very disappointed. After a long day visiting the sights of San Diego, I was so looking forward to returning to a fresh, clean room. However, we were again disappointed when we discovered that the maid service had completely skipped our room! When I called the Front Desk, Kimmy apologized but we were never contacted by a manager or anyone else. If you're in the mood to watch TV, there were not that many channels to choose from, compared with other hotels we've stayed at. There is free wi-fi, and that was a nice bonus. This hotel is located near several office buildings and seems to cater to the business crowd. Breakfast costs $7 unless you are with a group who has a contract with the hotel. That is how it was explained to me. On the other hand, each adult gets a free cocktail between 5 and 10 p.m.! Never heard of that before. In summary, we would never return to this hotel nor would we recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ljwells085
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Radisson Rancho Bernardo in San Diego. The staff was courteous, rooms clean, breakfast was good as well as the evening cocktails. Traveling with 2 young kids is never easy, so after the first night my mother requested another room and was given a great rate. No complaints at all!!! I would return to this hotel, just wish it was closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for my parents”
Reviews.Author: CLT_7
Reviews.Content: My parents chose this hotel through Expedia. I called the staff early in the day to obtain directions and asked if they could take very good care of my parents because traveling is very hard on my mother. The staff was wonderful! They upgraded the room and took excellant care of my parents. The pool is enclosed in the center of the hotel, which made things safe for my kids to take a swim with their grandparents. The hotel is located in a quiet area of RB, which made it peaceful. They have a beautiful lobby. It is a short drive to the 15 freeway, which makes it a very convenient location.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel San Diego-Rancho Bernardo
HotelInfo.Address: 11520 West Bernardo Court, San Diego, CA 92127
